title: Share big house in amazing area w/professionals & PU academics
description:
Unique house share in beautiful area of Princeton: Large house shared by mid-20s to early-30s academics and professionals, all of whom are vaccinated and follow CDC guidelines for staying safe. Backyard trail through 5+ private acres of woods and wildlife, walkable/bikable to PU, Bristol-Meyers Squibb and Educational Testing Service.
Avail immediately is a furnished (or unfurnished, if preferred) 16' x 12' room w/wall-length closet, 4 large windows and oak floors for $975/month, plus the $200/month common fee -- which covers utilities, weekly maid service (including bedroom if desired), grounds care, house supplies (incl laundry and dish detergent, paper products, etc.), fastest wifi and media, wine and snack subscriptions detailed below -- a total of $1175/month.
New housemates are chosen by consensus of existing housemates after a 15-minute interview, ensuring a warm, compatible environment with good boundaries. Housemates tend to be attracted to the house by the privacy, easy sense of community, carefully selected housemates, and the convenience of having weekly housekeeping service, fastest wifi, house supplies (paper towels, toilet paper, cooking and cleaning supplies), groundskeeping and all utilities taken care of in the common fee. Also included in the common fee are monthly wine and artisanal snack subscriptions, and subscriptions to YouTube TV, Netflix, Disney +, HBOMax, etc.
The house has an unusual floor plan that divides bedrooms into four separate "wings," affording greater privacy than in a typical house. The kitchen is great, with a separate large cabinet for each housemate plus common plates, glasses, utensils, pro-grade pots and pans, etc. It has two refrigerators, stainless steel appliances (gas stove), oak floors. The house has three full baths, each shared by two.
Flexible start date in Aug or Sept 1. Flexible lease term, though we typically sign leases through Aug of the following year (in accord w/ the academic schedule), with the option of leaving early or renewing with 60 days notice. If you have your own bed, ours can be put into storage here. Washer/dryer. Please, no cats or couples. 2.8 miles to campus, w/well-maintained walkway and sidewalk the full way. Easily walkable or bikable to the campuses of Princeton University, Bristol-Meyers Squibb and ETS.

title: No lease. Weekly rates starting at $620.
description:
A budget-friendly extended stay hotel in Bethlehem, PA
We invite you to experience the conveniences of home at WoodSpring Suites® Allentown Bethlehem. Our all-suite hotel with in-room kitchens is the perfect choice for your extended stay, whether it’s for a week, a month, or longer. We offer low nightly, weekly, and monthly hotel rates to help save you money. Plus, you'll enjoy free WiFi, guest laundry facilities and free parking at our 100% smoke-free, pet-friendly property, making your stay simple and hassle-free.
You'll enjoy quick access to a variety of destinations and attractions when you stay at our hotel in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. If you’d like to take advantage of public transportation, we're right on the 108, 217, 319, and 327 local LANta bus routes, while the Amtrak Bus Station is just 6 miles away. We're about 8 miles from the Lehigh Valley International Airport/ABE Airport. $50 to $100 Deposit.
Hotel at a Glance
5 miles to Lehigh Valley Hospital Muhlenberg
6 miles to St. Luke’s Hospital Anderson Campus
6 miles to Greyhound and Amtrak stations
8 miles to Lehigh Valley International Airport
Nightly, weekly and monthly hotel rates
Full kitchen in every room
Guest Rooms
Visit our extended stay hotel and select the suite layout that meets your needs. Each layout features a combination of double-/full-sized beds and sleeper sofas, as well as a dresser, nightstand and shelves. All suites also include a kitchen with full-size refrigerator, stovetop, microwave, cupboards and prep sink. Sit back and relax during your stay while enjoying free WiFi and a flat-screen TV with cable/satellite and a premium movie channel. Every-other-week housekeeping services are provided for long-stay guests. Additional items—including a linen exchange, cookware, dishes, and more frequent housekeeping—are available for purchase at the front desk.
Explore activities for all ages in Allentown Bethlehem
You're in the heart of it all when you stay at WoodSpring Suites in Allentown Bethlehem, where you'll find a variety of exciting attractions and destinations. History buffs will enjoy visiting the nearby Pennsbury Manor, the reconstructed estate of William Penn, who founded the Pennsylvania colony. We're also an easy drive to a number of family friendly activities, including Crayola Experience, Dorney Park and Wildwater Kingdom, and Lehigh Valley Zoo. Artists and creative types will want to check out the Banana Factory Arts Center, a collection of galleries and arts programs partly housed in a former banana distribution warehouse, about 9 miles away.
Show Less
Pet Policy
Service animals are welcome at no additional charge, must be registered at front desk. Limit 2 dogs, under 75 lbs. per room. No cats. Non-refundable pet fees, 50 USD a pet reg fee and 10 USD a pet per night charge for the duration of the stay.
Hotel Alert: Some hotel features and amenities may be modified or unavailable due to COVID-19. For more information, please call your hotel directly.
Amenities to help you stay awhile
WoodSpring Suites is an extended stay hotel with clean and comfortable rooms, and a professional, friendly staff that’s available to assist you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Our 100% smoke-free hotel offers pet-friendly hotel rooms, free parking, guest laundry facilities and conveniently located vending machines. Daily, weekly and monthly hotel rates are available.

Hello, I’m a 75-year-old retiree seeking a room in greater San Diego. I grew up in La Jolla, graduated from Caltech, worked at IBM and Denali until about a decade ago, and am again living in Bay Park but have to relocate in August. I’m searching for a room in a home with another older professional or retired person.
As of last year, I'm using a walker sometimes so first-floor units are preferable. Ideally, the location has a couple of restaurants, shops, etc. within a few blocks. My budget is about $1k/month, including utilities, but flexible. Please feel free to contact me with questions, email preferred.Hi,
As the title says, I’m hoping to rent a room for myself and my son.
By Sept 1st.
Single mom and employed, busy schedule during the week.
We’re both tidy and quiet little people. Respectful and considerate.
No drugs, no drinking, no 420, (no issue if you do)
no drama.👍🏽
Genuinely just looking for a place to get comfortable.
Depending on the vibe, would prefer long term agreement, like year lease?
I have references, and am able pay up to $1000.
Willing to help with stuff, for decreased rent.
Cleaning, simple errands, gentle busy work.
Myself, 32 and son, 13.
Ideally one room with a parking spot is perfect.
Thanks for reading.
-M

I don't really know anyone here I won't be having any guests at all. I'm also very clean person. If you would consider reading to me please give me a call I really can't afford over 800 a month right now.

title: Sunny Bedroom Lease takeover - Sept 1
description:
$1000/mo Sunny & Bright 1 Bedroom in West Philly with South facing bay windows in the living room, a large hallway for a dining room or office space, kitchen with new cabinets & stovetop, bathroom with a spacious floor tub. Love this space and advocated for updates to the apartment like new insulated windows (cost-friendly heat & cooler summers) & a brand new stovetop.
A very large bedroom with French doors and a walk in closet in between the bathroom and bedroom so you have 2 entrances to the bathroom (from the hallway and bedroom.) The bedroom and walk in closet/room have beautiful stained glass windows.
There’s a beautiful view into the backyard which has a gazebo and grill, outside stairway access to the laundry room (free) from the kitchen & a quiet backyard.
This is perfect for one-person and could also work for a couple. The square footage & original wooden floors are stellar for the price — and the location is close to the 46st mfl line & the 21 bus stop is right off Walnut.
Only 4 units (studio, 1 bedroom & 2 bedrooms) in building & neighbors are quiet — most are queer & keep to themselves.
Looking for a Sept 1st lease takeover - lease ends at the end of June 2023 though you could negotiate with the landlord: he prefers leases to end during a summer month.
Security deposit & last month rent for move-in. Flexible move-in date, could move in August 24th earliest. Will schedule visits & send you application to fill out with landlord

title: BEAUTIFUL, SPACIOUS 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom house with big backyard!
description:
BEAUTIFUL 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom house with big backyard!
This is an incredibly beautiful, spacious, updated house located on a quiet street in a very nice area of Claymont, Delaware. Here are just some of the details:
- 3 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms with a spacious living room, dining room and kitchen open to the dining room
- Huge backyard with green space, a fire pit, covered porch, and raised beds for vegetable gardening
- Renovated kitchen, bathrooms, hardwood floors, newer kitchen appliances
- Top quality front-loading washer and dryer
- Spacious basement and garage for tons of storage
- Efficient forced air AC system so no need for window AC units
- Radiator heat for comfortable, even heat during the winter
- Quiet street with kind, friendly neighbors
- Beautiful Rolling Park just 2 blocks away
- Rented by owner who lives nearby in Philadelphia, so you can avoid dealing with the hassle of property management companies
- Just a 5 minute drive from Claymont train station, so quick and easy access to Philadelphia
- I-95 is less than 5 minutes away for easy travel
- Convenient location for traffic-free travel to and from Wilmington, Christiana Hospital, Dupont, Nemours Children's Hospital, the University of Pennsylvania, Drexel University, Hospital at the University of Pennsylvania, Children's Hospital of Philadelphia (CHOP), Presbyterian Hospital, Center City, Jefferson Hospital, Temple University Hospital, and points all over Philadelphia and Wilmington
- Many supermarkets and stores nearby (Food Lion, Sprouts, Shop-Rite, Acme, Target) as well as the Christiana Mall, Home Depot, Total Wine, all within a 15 minute drive. Food Lion is the nearest supermarket, less than 5 minutes away.
Rent is $1,995/month. House will be available for an August 15th lease start date, with a minimum 1 year lease.  First month, last month, and 1 month security deposit are required.
Tenant is responsible for paying all utilities (electric, gas, and water, as well as internet, cable, or other utilities desired by tenant).
**No smokers and no pets, sorry.**
Please feel free to email or text me with any questions or to schedule a tour.
Thanks!
Max
